HowToCreateAccount.question: How to create account?
answers: Click to Register.
Fill in the registration form: enter first name, last name, email, mobile number and create the password.
Enter the billing information: street and street number, country, Zip code and city.
If the user register on behalf of a company, than enter additional information: company name and tax number.
This step is to activate your account. A verification code is sent to the email address. If the code has not been sent, the user can resend the email.

HowToCreateTheProject.question: How to create the project?
answers: To create a New project, press the button.

A new new window appears, where users can add details like: name of the future project and description. The user presses save, if he/she wants to create the project or cancel, than the project won’t be added.
The pop-up window appears confirming, that the project has been created.

HowToChangeTheProjectNameDescriptionAndL.question: How to change the project name, description and location?
answers: The project name and description can be changed under settings in general information. The user can also choose the name of the city, where the project is located. After submitting the changes will be saved.

HowToChangeTheProjectPicture.question: How to change the project picture?
answers: Under settings press the clip:
Choose the picture from your PC (it can be chosen any picture). Then press upload and the picture appears on the project page

HowToDeleteTheProject.question: How to delete the project?
answers: Project and all related data will be deleted when the user presses «Delete project».

HowCanIFindTheProjectInTheHomepage.question: How can I find the project, in the homepage?
answers: Enter the project name in the «Search» field and this project will be the only one displayed in the list.

HowToAddTheRoom.question: How to add the area?
answers: In menu item Area press the button ADD AREA.
In the modal window, the area name must be entered and an image (any image from the PC) or  icon (from the icon library) must be selected. The area is created by saving the data.

HowToEditRoomAndDeleteRoom.question: How to edit and delete an area?
answers: Press the 3 vertical dots and the user can see the pop-up menu. Edit Area sub menu is responsible if user want to change something in the area – (name, picture, icon). In sub menu user can delete area.

CanIChangePlaceOfTheRooms.question: Can I change the location of the Areas?
answers: Yes, the user can change the area location of the area in any order. Press the button draggable and move the area to another place. To deactivate drag and drop, press the button draggable a second time.

HowCanIFindDeviceOrChartInRooms.question: How can I find a device or a chart in areas?
answers: Start typing the name of the device or chart and they will appear at the top of the list.

CanIFavoritesTheChartsOrDevicesWhichIUsu.question: Can I favorites the charts or devices which I usually use?
answers: Yes, the user can press the 3 vertical dots to add the device or chart to the Favourites. Under the menu item Favourites it is possible to see all the favourite devices and charts. If devices or diagrams should be deleted from the favourites, simply press the 3 vertical dots again and than "Delete from favourites".

HowICanFindTheDeviceOrChartInTheFavorite.question: How I can find the device or chart in the favorites?
answers: Start to type the name of the device or chart and they are appearing on the top of the list.

HowToCreateTheChartInWorkbench.question: How to create the chart in the Workbench?
answers: Workbench - under Charts - ADD CHART
To create a chart users should select any name and type of chart from the drop-down menu. On the right side the possibility to see a preview of the chart and information has been added.
For mapping, a maximum of 9 variables can be selected, any unit can be set, the name of the chart can be defined and the scaling can be chosen - automatically or manually.
In this step the user needs to chose the area and after pressing SEND the chart will be created in the needed area.

HowCanUserUploadTheCSVFileFromChartWithD.question: How can the user download the CSV file from chart?
answers: Press the download button and the CSV file saves automatically.

CanISeeTheDifferentChartViewOfTheColumnC.question: Can I see the different chart view of the column chart?
answers: The button change the chart view changed automatically.

WhereICanFindTheVisualizationOfChartsWhi.question: Where I can find the visualization of charts, which I can create?
answers: In the device library under charts the user can find a visualization of all existing chats and information.

HowCanIActivateFullScreenChart.question: How can I activate the full screen mode for charts?
answers: The user can press the «full screen» button and activate the full chart view.

WhereCanISeeLiveChart.question: Where can I see the live chart?
answers: The live chart can be activated by the user selecting the "Live" button in the chart. The data is refreshed every second and comes via MQTT.

HowCanIGetDataForPeriod.question: How can I get data for a specific period?
answers: User can get data for day, week, month and year using tabs and calendar.

HowToUseChartCalculation.question: How to use chart calculation?
answers: To use the chart calculation first you need to select «Calculation» in the execution field marked in the images.

{'After that you are able to write your expression inside the big «Math expression» field. To add a variable you can simply press '}{'"@"'}{' and after that you get a filtered list of availible variables. You are able to use the following Math operators ( + , - , * , / ) paried with the parenthesis to create the calculation. Adding static numbers is also possible. If the calculation is incorrect an error message will be visible right under the textfield.'}

To select a aggregation for each variable that is used inside the calculation. Just click on the «AGGREGATION OPTIONS». In there a list of all variables will be shown and the aggregation can be selected in the given dropdown menus.

HowToCreateTheDeviceInWorkbench.question: How to create a new device in the Workbench?
answers: Press the button «add device».
In the modal windows, create the device name and choose the type of device from the drop down menu.
After selecting the device - on the right-hand side user can see the preview of the item can try how it works with mock data and read the information about this device.
In this step user add the mappings to the device.
In drop down menu the user can choose the area and assign it to the device. After pressing «send» the device appears in the current area.

HowLookLikeAllDevicesWhichICanCreateInWo.question: What do all the devices look like that I can create in the workbench?
answers: In the device library, the user can find the performance and information about the devices.

WhatCanISeeUnderSettingsInDevice.question: What can I see under settings in the device?
answers: Here the user can find further settings and operating options for the device.

HowToEditProfile.question: How to edit the profile?
answers: On the upper right corner press the button and in the pop-up menu the user can edit the profile.

HowToLogout.question: How to logout?
answers: In the upper right corner the user can find the logout.

CanIChangeTheBackgroundInAnotherColor.question: Can I change the background to another color?
answers: Yes, user can change the background in dark mode. Need to press the dark theme button.

HowBackToHomeFastFromAnyPageOfTheSystem.question: How do I quickly get back to the home page from any page in the system?
answers: The user can press the Lynus logo or the Home button to return to the Home screen.

HowToSeeMoreDevicesOnThePage.question: How to display more devices on the page?
answers: The user can activate the button “Toggle Area size”, which closes part of the areas.

ToggleVisibilityOfOptionalVariablesInDev.question: How to toggle the visibility of optional Variables in Edit window of Devices and MPC`s?
answers: With the Checkbox in the bottom right corner you are able to toggle the visibility of the optional variable fields.

HowToAddMPCController.question: How to add a ML Model?
answers: Select ML-Model in the workbench and than press the "Add ML-Model" button.
In the modal window choose the name and type of the ML model controller. At the right side users can see the preview of the MPC controller.
On this step the required variables can be assigned. The user can also add the additional room temperature an unlimited number of times.
In the step Settings, the user can select the area in which the ML model controller should be located from the list of created areas. Then press Send. After that, the ML model controller is created.

HowLookLikeAIMLChartsAndWhereICanGetInfo.question: How do AI/ML charts look like and where can I get information about them?
answers: In the AI/ML library users can find the information and the display of live anomaly detection and history anomaly detection.

HowToCreateAnomalyDetectionInWorkbench.question: How to create an anomaly detection in the workbench?
answers: Press ADD AI/ML button.

After pressing the ADD AI/ML button a modal window appears, where user can insert the name and choose the type of anomaly detection from the drop down menu. On the right-side the user can see the preview of the chart and read the information.

For mappings the user have has the possibility to add the Unit (C), add a maximum of 9 variables (press ADD VARIABLE), change the name of the chart (if the name is not added, than the name shown on the chart will be the name of the variable) and choose scaling – automatic or manual (for manual any data can be used). For the output anomaly score, the variable and the heartbeat should also be added.

In the settings, the user can define the range in which the anomaly score chart should be displayed and set the threshold value (15 by default) and the time series length (5 by default). After pressing SEND, the anomaly score is created.

WhatCanISeeOnMap.question: What can I see on the map?
answers: On the map, the user can see the location of all existing projects and by clicking on the pin, it is possible to see the name and description on the map. By clicking on the project name, the user is redirected to the project.

WhereICanSeeAllExistingVariables.question: Where I can see all existing variables
answers: The variable list contains all variables that belong to the project.

CanIMoveDevicesAndChartsInDifferentOrder.question: Can I move devices and charts in a different order?
answers: Yes, the user can move devices and charts. The user has to activate the "Draggable" button and than move the chart or device. After the user has finished moving the items, press the "Draggable" button a second time to deactivate the "Drag and Drop" function.

WhatUserCanDoWithPermissions.question: What can the user do with permissions?
answers: The Admin can control charts and devices and also create new ones. Users can only control devices. An Admin can assign admin rights to a normal user. Before the user can be added under Permissions the user must first create an account. Only then he can be searched by e-mail address and then be added.

WhatICanFindInSettingsDocumentation.question: What I can find under Settings/Project documents?
answers: Here users can, for e.g upload datasheets from his machine or project

WhereICanFindMQTTInformation.question: Where I can find MQTT informations?
answers: In setting/MQTT the user can find information about port, hostname, topic publish and topic subscribe. This information is used to connect a MQTT client to the broker.

WhereICanDownloadTheBeckhoffLibraryAndCe.question: Where can I download the Beckhoff library and certificate?
answers: In Settings/Download user can click on the buttons and download the documents.

WhatCanISeeUnderRulesAndHowICanAddARule.question: What can I see under Rules and how I can add a Rule?
answers: A rule can be used to create simple logical links with the existing variables of the project. If the logic applies or is fulfilled, an event can be triggered.

WhichConditionsCanIChooseToFillInTheForm.question: What conditions can I choose when filling in the form?
answers: The first thing to do wile creating a rule is to assign a name. Next, the logical links between the project variables can be created. At last, the event can be selected that should be executed if the logic applies. This can be an email notification, a Webhook-integration or the event list. It is also possible to execute multiple events at the same time.

InformationAboutTheBody.question: Useful information about the Body.
answers: {'If you add an action, "{{rule}} -" will be automatically added in the body. Afterwards, this placeholder will be replaced with the name of the rule. It is also possible to add a placeholder for the actual variable value when the rule gets triggered by adding "{{VariableName}}".'}

HowToCreateAnAutomaticRule.question: How to create an automatic Rule?
answers: All Lynus devices have the possibility to link an error/warning variable with them. Thereby 2 rules are automatically created for the respective device. One for the error and one for the warning. The generated actions are then displayed in the event list. Additional actions like email and webhock can then be optionally added to the respective rule. The allowed values for the error and the warning can be seen under "allowed values".

WhatCanBeSetAboutTheTimeSettingInTheRule.question: What can be set about the time setting in the rules?
answers: The time specification can be used to select the delay with which the rule is to be activated. This means that when the logic applies, it is checked again after this time has elapsed whether the logic still applies. If this is the case, the linked action is executed.

WhatCanISeeUnderEventList.question: What can I see under Event list?
answers: In the Event list you can see all events that are triggered by a rule.

WhereShouldIContactIfIHaveProblemsOrQues.question: Where should I contact if I have problems or questions?
answers: {'In case you have any further questions or experiencing some problems, please contact us at support'}{'@'}{'efficientio.com'}
